title: Remove Auto-Detection and Default to JSON Storage
description: Refactor configuration manager to use JSON (local) as the default storage type and remove auto-detection logic. This will make configuration more predictable and require explicit storage type specification for non-JSON storage.

context.businessContext: Auto-detection can be confusing and unpredictable, especially in deployment environments. Making JSON the default and requiring explicit configuration for other storage types will make the system more predictable and easier to debug.
context.technicalContext: The current auto-detection logic checks for various environment variables and can lead to unexpected storage selection. By defaulting to JSON and requiring explicit configuration, we make the behavior more predictable and easier to understand.
acceptanceCriteria: Remove auto-detection logic from configuration manager
Set JSON (local) as the default storage type
Require explicit DEVLOG_STORAGE_TYPE for non-JSON storage
Update error messages to guide users toward explicit configuration
Update documentation to reflect the new default behavior
